result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian C Clemons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Each ct concur. Credit does NOT apply.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $1,000 per case.  Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
Final pre-trial on July 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:28
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jon O. Helland.  Robert Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall continue to cooperate with DCBM.   If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.  Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.

Defendant appeared.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail   If the Def fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Def posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Def is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Def is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
